metadata.title: CVE-2020-15654 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
When in an endless loop, a website specifying a custom cursor using CSScould make it look like the user is interacting with the user interface,when they are not. This could lead to a perceived broken state, especiallywhen interactions with existing browser dialogs and warnings do not work.This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, andThunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
